Description: Gold amulet: cast gold, long-eared, long-tailed animal identified as a canine but with hooves. The suspension loops are on the left side, two on the body, and two on the base.
Curator's comments: According to Andrews, 'Ancient Egyptian Jewellery' (1990), p. 180, this amulet is from the pyramid of Queen Amanishakheto, Meroe.
Published: Africa in Antiquity vol.2, Brooklyn 1978, p. 247 [176].
